entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 1.1 a-b** *तस्मादेतद्वर्जनीयं नरेण; दुष्टं लोके गर्हणीयं च कर्म |*
Who is described as the one who avoids evil deeds?
A) Yudhiṣṭhira B) Rāma C) King D) Bhīma
entry.answer: C) King • The verse states "the king avoids evil deeds" — the missing word is "नरेण" (king). • Yudhiṣṭhira and Rāma are not mentioned here. • Bhīma is a warrior, not the subject of this verse.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 2.1 a-b** *अष्टक उवाच|| यदा तु तान्वितुदन्ते वयांसि; तथा गृध्राः शितिकण्ठाः पतङ्गाः |*
What creatures are described as "shitting their mouths" (metaphor for greed)?
A) Birds B) Snakes C) Vultures D) Insects
entry.answer: C) Vultures • "गृध्राः" (vultures) are explicitly named in the verse. • "Shitting their mouths" metaphorically describes vultures. • Snakes and insects are not mentioned here.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 3.1 a-b** *ययातिरुवाच|| ऊर्ध्वं देहात्कर्मणो जृम्भमाणा; द्व्यक्तं पृथिव्यामनुसञ्चरन्ति |*
What beings move "upward from the body" (metaphor for spiritual ascent)?
A) Humans B) Devas C) Animals D) Ghosts
entry.answer: B) Devas • "ऊर्ध्वं" (upward) and "कर्मणो" (from action) imply divine beings. • Humans and animals are "downward" in this context. • Ghosts are not referenced here.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 4.1 a-b** *षष्टिं सहस्राणि पतन्ति व्योम्नि; तथा अशीतिं परिवत्सराणि |*
How many years do "the wicked" fall into hell?
A) 60,000 B) 80,000 C) 100,000 D) 120,000
entry.answer: B) 80,000 • "अशीतिं" (80) is numerically correct. • "षष्टिं" (60) refers to the number of years for others. • 100,000 and 120,000 are not mentioned.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 5.1 a-b** *अष्टक उवाच|| यदेनसस्ते पततस्तुदन्ति; भीमा भौमा राक्षसास्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्राः |*
What creatures "bite with sharp teeth" (metaphor for destruction)?
A) Demons B) Tigers C) Snakes D) Lions
entry.answer: A) Demons • "राक्षसाः" (demons) are explicitly named. • Tigers and lions are not referenced. • Snakes are not described as "sharp-toothed" here.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 6.1 a-b** *ययातिरुवाच|| अस्रं रेतः पुष्पफलानुपृक्त; मन्वेति तद्वै पुरुषेण सृष्टम् |*
What is described as "created by the man" (metaphor for life)?
A) Earth B) Water C) Life D) Sky
entry.answer: C) Life • "मन्वेति" (man) implies life. • Earth and water are not "created by the man" here. • Sky is not mentioned.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 7.1 a-b** *वनस्पतींश्चौषधीश्चाविशन्ति; अपो वायुं पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षम् |*
What elements do "plants and herbs" enter (metaphor for nature's cycle)?
A) Water B) Air C) Earth D) Sky
entry.answer: D) Sky • "अन्तरिक्षम्" (sky) is the missing word. • Plants and herbs are part of earth and air. • Sky is the final destination in this metaphor.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 8.1 a-b** *अष्टक उवाच|| अन्यद्वपुर्विदधातीह गर्भ; उताहो स्वित्स्वेन कामेन याति |*
What is described as "entering a womb" (metaphor for rebirth)?
A) Soul B) Body C) Spirit D) Mind
entry.answer: A) Soul • "गर्भ" (womb) implies rebirth of the soul. • Body and mind are not "entering" the womb. • Spirit is a synonym but less precise here.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 9.1 a-b** *शरीरदेहादिसमुच्छ्रयं च; चक्षुःश्रोत्रे लभते केन सञ्ज्ञाम् |*
What sense "gains awareness" (metaphor for consciousness)?
A) Sight B) Hearing C) Touch D) Smell
entry.answer: B) Hearing • "श्रोत्रे" (hearing) is the missing word. • Sight and touch are also senses but not specified here. • Smell is not mentioned.

entry.question:
**Sambhava-parva 10.1 a-b** *ययातिरुवाच|| वायुः समुत्कर्षति गर्भयोनि; मृतौ रेतः पुष्परसानुपृक्तम् |*
What element "rises from the womb" (metaphor for spiritual growth)?
A) Air B) Water C) Fire D) Earth
entry.answer: A) Air • "वायुः" (air) is explicitly named. • Water and earth are not "rising" here. • Fire is a metaphor for destruction, not growth.
